page.title: 19CAUTE
page.content: Caute is a small hamlet one and a half miles from the village of Shebbear. It contains one dairy farm, three dwelling houses (one of which is the headquarters of Stoneleigh Calf Farm) and a small Baptist Church. This is an area with many Methodist chapels, and parish churches, but here and there among them is a Baptist place of worship. The chapel goes back to around 1850 and seats 70 people. It has an average congregation of about 12 and meets for worship once each Sunday, alternately in the morning and in the afternoon. It is linked with three other Baptist Churches all of which share the same Minister.
